get.description:
Search for FRED series or economic releases by ID or string.

This does not return the observation values, only the metadata.
Use this function to find series IDs for `fred_series()`.

parameters.name: query

schema.description: The search word(s).
schema.title: Query

parameters.description: The search word(s).

parameters.name: is_release

schema.title: fred
schema.description: Is release?  If True, other search filter variables are ignored. If no query text or release_id is supplied, this defaults to True. (provider: fred)

parameters.description: Is release?  If True, other search filter variables are ignored. If no query text or release_id is supplied, this defaults to True. (provider: fred)

parameters.name: release_id

schema.title: fred
schema.description: A specific release ID to target. (provider: fred)

parameters.description: A specific release ID to target. (provider: fred)

parameters.name: limit

schema.title: fred
schema.description: The number of data entries to return. (1-1000) (provider: fred)

parameters.description: The number of data entries to return. (1-1000) (provider: fred)

parameters.name: offset

schema.title: fred
schema.description: Offset the results in conjunction with limit. (provider: fred)

parameters.description: Offset the results in conjunction with limit. (provider: fred)

parameters.name: filter_variable

schema.title: fred
schema.description: Filter by an attribute. (provider: fred)

parameters.description: Filter by an attribute. (provider: fred)

parameters.name: filter_value

schema.title: fred
schema.description: String value to filter the variable by.  Used in conjunction with filter_variable. (provider: fred)

parameters.description: String value to filter the variable by.  Used in conjunction with filter_variable. (provider: fred)

parameters.name: tag_names

schema.title: fred
schema.description: A semicolon delimited list of tag names that series match all of.  Example: 'japan;imports' Multiple comma separated items allowed. (provider: fred)

parameters.description: A semicolon delimited list of tag names that series match all of.  Example: 'japan;imports' Multiple comma separated items allowed. (provider: fred)

parameters.name: exclude_tag_names

schema.title: fred
schema.description: A semicolon delimited list of tag names that series match none of.  Example: 'imports;services'. Requires that variable tag_names also be set to limit the number of matching series. Multiple comma separated items allowed. (provider: fred)

parameters.description: A semicolon delimited list of tag names that series match none of.  Example: 'imports;services'. Requires that variable tag_names also be set to limit the number of matching series. Multiple comma separated items allowed. (provider: fred)

parameters.name: series_id

schema.title: fred
schema.description: A FRED Series ID to return series group information for. This returns the required information to query for regional data. Not all series that are in FRED have geographical data. Entering a value for series_id will override all other parameters. Multiple series_ids can be separated by commas. (provider: fred)

parameters.description: A FRED Series ID to return series group information for. This returns the required information to query for regional data. Not all series that are in FRED have geographical data. Entering a value for series_id will override all other parameters. Multiple series_ids can be separated by commas. (provider: fred)

get.description: Get data by series ID from FRED.

parameters.name: symbol

schema.description: Symbol to get data for. Multiple comma separated items allowed for provider(s): fred.
schema.title: Symbol

parameters.description: Symbol to get data for. Multiple comma separated items allowed for provider(s): fred.

parameters.name: start_date

schema.description: Start date of the data, in YYYY-MM-DD format.
schema.title: Start Date

schema.description: End date of the data, in YYYY-MM-DD format.
schema.title: End Date

parameters.description: End date of the data, in YYYY-MM-DD format.

parameters.name: limit

schema.description: The number of data entries to return.
schema.title: Limit

parameters.description: The number of data entries to return.

parameters.name: frequency

schema.title: fred
schema.description:
Frequency aggregation to convert high frequency data to lower frequency.
        
    None = No change
        
    a = Annual
        
    q = Quarterly
        
    m = Monthly
        
    w = Weekly
        
    d = Daily
        
    wef = Weekly, Ending Friday
        
    weth = Weekly, Ending Thursday
        
    wew = Weekly, Ending Wednesday
        
    wetu = Weekly, Ending Tuesday
        
    wem = Weekly, Ending Monday
        
    wesu = Weekly, Ending Sunday
        
    wesa = Weekly, Ending Saturday
        
    bwew = Biweekly, Ending Wednesday
        
    bwem = Biweekly, Ending Monday
         (provider: fred)

parameters.description:
Frequency aggregation to convert high frequency data to lower frequency.
        
    None = No change
        
    a = Annual
        
    q = Quarterly
        
    m = Monthly
        
    w = Weekly
        
    d = Daily
        
    wef = Weekly, Ending Friday
        
    weth = Weekly, Ending Thursday
        
    wew = Weekly, Ending Wednesday
        
    wetu = Weekly, Ending Tuesday
        
    wem = Weekly, Ending Monday
        
    wesu = Weekly, Ending Sunday
        
    wesa = Weekly, Ending Saturday
        
    bwew = Biweekly, Ending Wednesday
        
    bwem = Biweekly, Ending Monday
         (provider: fred)

parameters.name: aggregation_method

schema.title: fred
schema.description:
A key that indicates the aggregation method used for frequency aggregation.
        This parameter has no affect if the frequency parameter is not set.
        
    avg = Average
        
    sum = Sum
        
    eop = End of Period
         (provider: fred)

    None = No transformation
        
    chg = Change

    pch = Percent Change
        
    pc1 = Percent Change from Year Ago
        
    pca = Compounded Annual Rate of Change
        
    cch = Continuously Compounded Rate of Change

examples.description: Multiple series can be passed in as a list.
Use the `transform` parameter to transform the data as change, log, or percent change.

schema.description: The element ID of a specific table in the release.

get.description:
Query the Geo Fred API for regional economic data by series group.

The series group ID is found by using `fred_search` and the `series_id` parameter.

parameters.name: symbol

schema.description: Symbol to get data for.
schema.title: Symbol

parameters.description: Symbol to get data for.

parameters.name: start_date

schema.description: Start date of the data, in YYYY-MM-DD format.
schema.title: Start Date

parameters.description: Start date of the data, in YYYY-MM-DD format.

parameters.name: end_date

schema.description: End date of the data, in YYYY-MM-DD format.
schema.title: End Date

parameters.description: End date of the data, in YYYY-MM-DD format.

parameters.name: limit

schema.description: The number of data entries to return.
schema.title: Limit

parameters.description: The number of data entries to return.

parameters.name: is_series_group

schema.title: fred
schema.description: When True, the symbol provided is for a series_group, else it is for a series ID. (provider: fred)

parameters.description: When True, the symbol provided is for a series_group, else it is for a series ID. (provider: fred)

parameters.name: region_type

schema.title: fred
schema.description: The type of regional data. Parameter is only valid when `is_series_group` is True. (provider: fred)

parameters.description: The type of regional data. Parameter is only valid when `is_series_group` is True. (provider: fred)

parameters.name: season

schema.title: fred
schema.description: The seasonal adjustments to the data. Parameter is only valid when `is_series_group` is True. (provider: fred)

parameters.description: The seasonal adjustments to the data. Parameter is only valid when `is_series_group` is True. (provider: fred)

parameters.name: units

schema.title: fred
schema.description: The units of the data. This should match the units returned from searching by series ID. An incorrect field will not necessarily return an error. Parameter is only valid when `is_series_group` is True. (provider: fred)

parameters.description: The units of the data. This should match the units returned from searching by series ID. An incorrect field will not necessarily return an error. Parameter is only valid when `is_series_group` is True. (provider: fred)
